commit_message:
Permit volume type operations for policy authorized users

Currently, following volume type operations are not
permitted for non admin users because these db operations
require admin context.

* create
* update
* delete
* type-access-add
* type-access-remove

       "is_admin:True or role:storage_type_admin",

3. Modify rule for types_manage.

We haven't had volume_type in expected_attrs for volume objects lists.
This resulted in situation in which although we were joining the

Volume type was then lazy loaded when needed, so every "cinder list"

infrastructure in the o.vo layer to be able to pass different values
when we query for just a single volume and when we fetch whole list (as

subject: Catch PortNotFound after HA router race condition
commit_message:
Catch PortNotFound after HA router race condition

When neutron server deleted all the resources of a
HA router, L3 agent can not aware that, so race
happened in some procedure like this:
1. Neutron server delete all resources of a HA router.
2. RPC fanout to L3 agent 1 in which the HA router was
   master state.
3. In l3 agent 2 'backup' router set itself to masert
   and notify neutron server a HA router state change
   notify.
4. PorNotFound rasied in updating router HA port status.

How the step 2 and 3 happens?
Consider that l3 agent 2 has much more HA routers than l3 agent 1,
or any reason that causes l3 agent 2 gets/processes the deleting
RPC later than l3 agent 1. Then l3 agent 1 remove HA router's
keepalived process will soonly be detected by backup router in
l3 agent 2 via VRRP protocol. Now the router deleting RPC is in
the queue of RouterUpdate or any step of a HA router deleting
procedure, and the router_info will still have 'the' router info.
So l3 agent 2 will do the state change procedure, AKA notify
the neutron server to update router state.

This patch is mainly to deal with the race by catching the
PorNotFound exception in neutron-server side.

Change-Id: I34d7347595bfceb8a70685672a6287e1a44ede6b
Closes-Bug: #1533454
Related-Bug: #1523780
(cherry picked from commit 472d84d25cee0694500e583845718a4f377cc75c)

Renew subscription on update with TTL

Now when we update subscription and specify TTL, subscription is not
renewed. It's life is not extended, and it's expiration date is still

Because of that, it's impossible to extend life of subscription without
recreating it. But during subscription recreation some messages may not

subject: Catch PortNotFound after HA router race condition
commit_message:
Catch PortNotFound after HA router race condition

When neutron server deleted all the resources of a
HA router, L3 agent can not aware that, so race
happened in some procedure like this:
1. Neutron server delete all resources of a HA router.
2. RPC fanout to L3 agent 1 in which the HA router was
   master state.
3. In l3 agent 2 'backup' router set itself to masert
   and notify neutron server a HA router state change
   notify.
4. PorNotFound rasied in updating router HA port status.

How the step 2 and 3 happens?
Consider that l3 agent 2 has much more HA routers than l3 agent 1,
or any reason that causes l3 agent 2 gets/processes the deleting
RPC later than l3 agent 1. Then l3 agent 1 remove HA router's
keepalived process will soonly be detected by backup router in
l3 agent 2 via VRRP protocol. Now the router deleting RPC is in
the queue of RouterUpdate or any step of a HA router deleting
procedure, and the router_info will still have 'the' router info.
So l3 agent 2 will do the state change procedure, AKA notify
the neutron server to update router state.

This patch is mainly to deal with the race by catching the
PorNotFound exception in neutron-server side.

Change-Id: I34d7347595bfceb8a70685672a6287e1a44ede6b
Closes-Bug: #1533454
Related-Bug: #1523780

Fix RPC timeouts seen in sync_state of DHCP Agent

  present at that point of time. When there are quite a few networks in

  and its resulting in an indefinite number of sync_state calls down the
  line. There is no guranteed time after which the DHCP agent can get stable

  call a helper method _get_active_networks. This helper method tries

  information. This is a time taking process and more over, this is not

subject: libvirt: check for optional LibvirtLiveMigrateData attrs before loading
commit_message:
libvirt: check for optional LibvirtLiveMigrateData attrs before loading

The _live_migration_operation method is accessing the nullable
attributes 'serial_listen_addr' and 'target_connect_addr' on the
LibvirtLiveMigrateData object which might not be set on the object.

Since they aren't lazy-loadable, this results in a NotImplementedError
if the attribute aren't set. This is fixed by adding conditional checks
in _live_migration_operation for the nullable attributes. Note that
bdms is nullable=False in the LiveMigrateDataObject and should be set
when the migrate_data object comes to the virt driver, so the test case
is updated in this case to fix the bdms attribute access.

There was a test hitting this, but because the libvirt driver runs
_live_migration_operation in a thread, the error was just being
logged and the test would pass.

So to fix that, the SpawnIsSynchronous fixture is used in the test
class to make the _live_migration_operation synchronous for that
test.

However, that doesn't fully resolve the gap in the test because
of the @catch_notimplemented decorator used on the test case. That
is meant for virt drivers which don't implement the live_migration
method but it can also allow silent failures in object attribute
access from bubbling up as failures. So this change also removes
that decorator from the test case.

Note that the tests themselves are pretty hacky in this case anyway
since while they are meant to be generic per virt driver, the
object passed down is LibvirtLiveMigrateData, which won't be
correct for xenapi, for example.

Closes-Bug: #1551925

In 0.6.2, the exc.statement and exc.params were as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%s, %s)'

In 0.7.1, the exc.statement and exc.params are as follows:
exc.statement = {unicode} u'INSERT INTO resource_entity (id, foo_id)
                VALUES (%(id)s, %(foo_id)s)'

subject: Increase partitioning logic period
commit_message:
Increase partitioning logic period

gnocchi uses the reporting worker to partition tasks across each of
the processing workers. by default reporter runs every 10s and
processor worker every 5s. unfortunately, in any environment, small
or large, the processor takes much longer than 10s to process it's
data. because of that, the repartition messages that the reporter
sends up queues up so the processor ends up running through a list
of stale repartition messages before it can grab a new set of
metrics.

This calls for an increase in the period of which the reporter runs.

subject: Simplify l2pop driver code
commit_message:
Simplify l2pop driver code

l2pop to use only port bindings and ignore port status
updates for deciding and notifying a port's fdb to agent.
When port is bound to new host, notify port added to agents.
When port is unbound, notify port removal to agents.

Also, previously, l2pop driver was identifying when first/last port on the
network on a host added/deleted and
1) notify other agents to add flood flow to this host
2) notify the host about ports on other agents
This is not needed for new agents as they maintain port info. With
this, agents themselves will be knowing about first and last port on
same host and also on other agents. Server still will have this code for
backword compatibility with old agents.

With this, agents will locally maintain all remote agent's port info
on a network in lvm(lvm exists when local agent is hosting that network).
lvm.tun_ofports={<remote_agent1_ofport>: [port1, port2, ..],
                 <remote_agent2_ofport>: [port3, port4, ..]}
For example, when port5 created on remote_agent1, port5 is added to
remote_agent1_ofport list and when port2 is removed from remote_agent1,
port2 deleted from remote_agent1_ofport list.
When last port removed from remote_agent1, lvm.tun_ofports['remote_agent1_ofport']
be empty and flood flow to this remote agent for that network is deleted.
When first port added in this list, flood flow to remote agent will be setup.

In this change new field 'port' added to fdb_entries. Previously 'ports' field
in fdb_entries was used to carry fdb for multiple ports, like below
fdb_entries={'ports': {[PortInfo(mac1,ip1), PortInfo(mac2,ip2)]}}
PortInfo created for each ip address. So to carry fdb for single port with multilple
ip addresses, multiple PortInfo used, like below
fdb_entries={'ports': {[PortInfo(same_mac,ip1), PortInfo(same_mac,ip2),
             PortInfo(same_mac,ip3), PortInfo('00:00:00:00:00:00', '0.0.0.0')]}}
But new agents won't get multiple ports as cast message and also won't need
flood entry('00:00:00:00:00:00', '0.0.0.0'). So 'port' field added to fdb_entries,
which carries fdb for single port. Also PortItem is used instead of PortInfo,
and one PortItem object for one port(instead of multiple PortInfo for one port).
PortItem will have port_id, mac and list of ip addresses.

A new RPC added for agent to get list of network ports on remote agents
from l2pop driver, and create above list when first port on network(new lvm)
on this local agent created(same happens on agent restarts).

DVR and HA ports also taken care in the change.

Seperate change to be proposed for supporting linuxbridge agent.

Closes-bug: #1535392
Change-Id: Iff030e526bad688cfc63cb9132720ad7adb3a01c
